{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.11267v1", "title": "Optimal control of geometric phase in pairs of interacting atoms
  traveling along two-dimensional closed paths", "summary": "Universal quantum gates whose operation depends on the manipulation of the
geometric phase of atomic systems are promising candidates for implementation
of quantum computing. We propose a scheme inducing a non-trivial
Aharonov-Anandan geometric phase in pairs of atoms interacting via
dipole-dipole potential. Our protocol relies on mobile optical trap technology
and consists of steering a single atom along a closed loop. The trajectory of
the atom is controlled by a mobile optical trap, and the shape of the path is
designed by applying an optimal control procedure. The geometric phase is
generated as a residual of the two-atom entanglement induced by the
dipole-dipole interaction. The stability of our scheme in the presence of noise
or experimental imperfections is discussed.", "main_category": "quant-ph", "categories": "quant-ph", "published": "2025-04-15T15:06:40Z"}
